results.title: Hip-Hop Bête Noire Changes Again
results.abstract: Just five years ago, a rapper like Riff Raff would have been unthinkable.

results.title: Nina Cassian, Exiled Romanian Poet, Dies at 89
results.abstract: Ms. Cassian sought refuge in the United States after her poems satirizing the regime of President Nicolae Ceausescu fell into the hands of the secret police.

results.title: The Personification of Legends
results.abstract: The carefully cultivated public personas of Billie Holiday and Louis Armstrong reach the stage in two productions, “Satchmo at the Waldorf” and “Lady Day at Emerson’s Bar & Grill.”
